Title: Grid Completion
Description: Your task is to create an n \times n grid whose each row and column has exactly one A and B. Some of the characters have already been placed. In how many ways can you complete the grid?
Input Specification:
The first input line has an integer n: the size of the grid. 
 After this, there are n lines that describe the grid. Each line has n characters: . means an empty square, and A and B show the characters already placed. 
 You can assume that every row and column has at most one A and B.
Output Specification: Print one integer: the number of ways modulo 10^9+7.
